title: Leicester 'murder': Wellwishers raise £10k for children of mum stabbed to death
text:

Wellwishers have raised almost £10,000 for the three young children of a mother who was stabbed to death at the family home.

Suvekshya Burathoki, who is originally from Nepal, died of multiple stab wounds at an address in Leicester in a case that is being treated as murder.

The 32-year-old mum's children are understood to have been at home at the time of the fatal attack.

Her body was found at about 8.30am on October 8 and a suspect, 29-year-old Hafiz Sharifi, of no fixed address, has been charged with murder, LeicestershireLive reports.

A GoFundMe page set up following Ms Burathoki's death has gone on to raise just over £9,700 as of Saturday morning.

(Image: BPM MEDIA)

The mum, also known as Fatima, was born in Dharan, Nepal, and "was an amazing mother to her three beautiful children" - two boys, aged nine and seven, and a three-year-old girl - "who she adored and were her world", the page states.

It adds: "She would also go out of her way to do anything for anyone."

Fundraising organiser Ayanah Lilly-Anne, who set up the GoFundMe page, also wrote: "As her friend and with support from the community, I decided to create this fundraising page to cover her funeral costs and to put together something for her three children.

"We still can’t believe what has happened! We will all miss you, beautiful Fatima.

"The money will be handed over to Fatima’s twin brother, Nirajan Burathoki, who is her next of kin."

(Image: Alex Hannam/BPM Media)

The funds will pay for Ms Burathoki's funeral and go to her children.

Another fundraiser said: "The children are going to need a lot of support and we would urge the community to continue to contribute to the fundraising page."

Police went to the mum's home following a report that a woman had been seriously injured inside.

She was pronounced dead at the scene, said Leicestershire Police.

A post-mortem revealed she had suffered multiple stab wounds, the force said.

A date for her funeral has not yet been set.

Some of her family members are still waiting for visas to come to the UK.
description: Suvekshya Burathoki's children are understood to have been at home at the time of the alleged murder in Leicester
